content.raw:
Added in 20fe05f. Do you think structuring it like this is a good approach?
```
pyteomics
├── __init__.py
├── mass
│   ├── __init__.py
│   ├── mass.py
│   └── unimod.py
```

`mass/__init__.py` star-imports from the old `mass.py` and also tries to import `unimod` (otherwise you can't access `mass.unimod` once you do `from pyteomics import mass`).
I also had to tweak `setup.py` accordingly.
I'm fine with changing this layout if needed.

Also, I get some deprecation warnings when running the tests:

```
/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/langhelpers.py:1366: DeprecationWarning: inspect.getargspec() is deprecated, use inspect.signature() instead
  spec = inspect.getargspec(fn)
test_unimod.py:25: PendingDeprecationWarning: generator '__iter__' raised StopIteration
  {alt for alt in mod.alternative_names})
```
And if I change the test case so that `setUpClass` says `cls.handle = unimod.Unimod('sqlite:///unimod.db')` instead of `cls.handle = unimod.Unimod()`, then I also see these warnings on Python 2.7:

```
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/sqltypes.py:185: SAWarning: Unicode type received non-unicode bind param value 'Amidated'. (this warning may be suppressed after 10 occurrences)
  (util.ellipses_string(value),))
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/sqltypes.py:185: SAWarning: Unicode type received non-unicode bind param value 'Deamidated'. (this warning may be suppressed after 10 occurrences)
  (util.ellipses_string(value),))
```

Do you think anything needs to be done about these?

Final question, do you have any idea what I should put in the copyright notice in the new module?
content.html:
Added in 20fe05f. Do you think structuring it like this is a good approach?

pyteomics
├── __init__.py
├── mass
│   ├── __init__.py
│   ├── mass.py
│   └── unimod.py

mass/__init__.py star-imports from the old mass.py and also tries to import unimod (otherwise you can't access mass.unimod once you do from pyteomics import mass). I also had to tweak setup.py accordingly. I'm fine with changing this layout if needed.

Also, I get some deprecation warnings when running the tests:

/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/langhelpers.py:1366: DeprecationWarning: inspect.getargspec() is deprecated, use inspect.signature() instead
  spec = inspect.getargspec(fn)
test_unimod.py:25: PendingDeprecationWarning: generator '__iter__' raised StopIteration
  {alt for alt in mod.alternative_names})

And if I change the test case so that setUpClass says cls.handle = unimod.Unimod('sqlite:///unimod.db') instead of cls.handle = unimod.Unimod(), then I also see these warnings on Python 2.7:

/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/sqltypes.py:185: SAWarning: Unicode type received non-unicode bind param value 'Amidated'. (this warning may be suppressed after 10 occurrences)
  (util.ellipses_string(value),))
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/sqltypes.py:185: SAWarning: Unicode type received non-unicode bind param value 'Deamidated'. (this warning may be suppressed after 10 occurrences)
  (util.ellipses_string(value),))

Do you think anything needs to be done about these?

Final question, do you have any idea what I should put in the copyright notice in the new module?
